intro: Phlegmariurus vanuatuensis, commonly known as the Vanuatu haircap, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, hair-like leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern around the stem. This moss thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its spore-producing structures, called sporophytes, are typically small and clustered at the tips of the stems. The plant plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
